turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: How come you're not at Sal's?

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: Is this another one of your patented two-hour lunches?

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: I just come home to take a quick shower.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Later for Sal.  Y'know, sometimes I think you're more concerned with him than me.

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: I think no such a thing.  Sal pays you, you should work.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Slavery days are over.  My name ain't Kunta Kinte.  Sis, I don't want to argue, stop pressing me.

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: I just don't want you to lose the one job you've been able to keep, that's all.  I'm carrying you as it is.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Don't worry 'bout me.  I always get paid.

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: Yeah, then ya should take better care of your responsibilities.

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: I didn't stutter.  Take care of your responsibilities.  Y'know exactly what I'm talking about.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Jade, I don't want you coming in here no mo'.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: No, you're tripping.  Don't come in Sal's.  Alright, read my lips.

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: What are you so worked up about?

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Over Sal, the way he talks and the way he looks at you.

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: I didn't stutter.  You heard me.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: You should see the way he looks at you.  All Sal wants to do is hide the salami.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: I might be, but you're not welcome here.

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: Stop trying to play big brother. I'm a grown woman.  You gotta lotta nerve.  Mookie, you can hardly pay your rent and you're gonna tell me what to do.  Come off it.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: One has nuthin' to do with the other.

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: Oh, it doesn't, huh!  You got your little 250 dollars a week plus tips...

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Pretty soon I'll be making a move.

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: I truly hope so.  I'm tired of supporting a grown man.

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: I know, Mother Sister, but I'm here now.  Where's the stuff?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SISTER
turns.text: I got nowhere to go.  We haven't had a good sit-down for a long while.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SISTER
turns.text: Tender-headed runs in my family. You tender-headed?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SISTER
turns.text: That's why I don't fool with it. Only let you touch it...Ouch!

turns.speaker: MOTHER SISTER
turns.text: Be gentle, child.  Mother Sister is an old woman.

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: How are you holding up in this weather?

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: I don't know why you still haven't bought an air conditioner.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SISTER
turns.text: Don't like 'em.  A fan will do.

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: You are too cruel to Da Mayor, it isn't right.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SISTER
turns.text: I'm not studying no Mayor.  Besides, he reminds me of my least favorite peoples.  My tenants and my ex- husband--Goddamn-bless his soul.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SISTER
turns.text: Number One: I got some jive, late- rent-paying trifling Negroes in this house.  Every year I keep threatening to sell it.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SISTER
turns.text: And move to Long Island.  Number Two: my ex-husband lost all my property, all my money in his scheme to build a Black business empire.  Needless to say what happened, this house is it, all I got.  I'm too through with yar people.

turns.speaker: RADIO RAHEEM
turns.text: D!  D!  D!  You dumb motherfucker. Learn how to speak English first.  D.

turns.speaker: MISTER SEÑOR LOVE DADDY
turns.text: C'mon, don't be shy.  Mmm, smells good.  This is ya Love Daddy talkin' to ya, starvin' like Marvin. Say something, Mookie.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Mister Señor Love Daddy, I'd like to dedicate the next record to my heart, Tina.

turns.speaker: MISTER SEÑOR LOVE DADDY
turns.text: Alright.  Let me play this record while I go to work on my chicken Parmigiana hero with extra cheese and extra sauce.

turns.speaker: MISTER SEÑOR LOVE DADDY
turns.text: Here ya are.  Keep the change.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: That's right on time.  This is my friend, Vito.  His pops is Sal.

turns.speaker: MISTER SEÑOR LOVE DADDY
turns.text: Tell ya father he makes the best heros in Brooklyn.

turns.speaker: SWEET DICK WILLIE
turns.text: Fool, you're thirty cents away from a quarter.  How you gonna get a boat?

turns.speaker: SWEET DICK WILLIE
turns.text: You're raggedy as a roach.  You eat the holes out of donuts.

turns.speaker: ML
turns.text: I'll be back on my feet.  Soon enough.

turns.speaker: SWEET DICK WILLIE
turns.text: So when is all this ice suppose to melt?

turns.speaker: ML
turns.text: Do I have to spell it out?

turns.speaker: ML
turns.text: Look at those Korean motherfuckers across the street.  I betcha they haven't been a year off da motherfucking boat before they opened up their own place.

turns.speaker: SWEET DICK WILLIE
turns.text: It's Miller time.  Let me go give these Koreans s'more business.

turns.speaker: SWEET DICK WILLIE
turns.text: Why you gotta talk 'bout my moms?

turns.speaker: SWEET DICK WILLIE
turns.text: I didn't say nobody, I said you.

turns.speaker: ML
turns.text: Sweet Dick, I didn't mean it like that.

turns.speaker: ML
turns.text: ML stands for ML.  That's it.

turns.speaker: SWEET DICK WILLIE
turns.text: Naw, that's some stupid shit.  Now you know how I got that name.

turns.speaker: ML
turns.text: Negroes kill me, always holdin' onto, talkin' 'bout their dicks.

turns.speaker: SWEET DICK WILLIE
turns.text: Korea man is OK.  Let's leave him alone.

turns.speaker: ML
turns.text: Him no white.  Him no white.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Who doesn't work?  Don't start no shit, won't be no shit.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Mookie, no cursing in the store.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Mookie, if your friends can't behave, they're not welcome.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: I got no say over people.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Mookie, what took you so long?  I got a business to run.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Be off in a second.  Tina, I dedicated a record on Mister Señor Love Daddy's show to you.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Mookie!  How is anybody gonna call in?

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Big deal?  If that's not LOVE, I don't know what is.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Sal, can you do me a favor?

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Sal, just this once, do me that solid.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: You know you don't get paid till we close tonight.  We're still open.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: I would like to get paid now.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Sal, I don't care if you fire me this exact minute, leave my sister alone.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Mookie, I don't know what you're talking about, plus I don't want to hear it.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Sal, just do me a favor, leave Jade alone.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Sal, if you want me to deliver any faster, get me a jet rocket or something, cuz I can't run with pizzas, all the cheese ends up on one side and shit.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: I didn't say nuthin'.  You must have a guilty conscience.  What are you guilty of?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: You must be guilty of something or you would have never come in saying the things you said.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: I wants my money.  I wants to get paid.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Mookie, I always liked you.  Not the smartest kid, but you're honest. Don't make me dislike you.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Don't even ask about your money. Your money wouldn't even pay for that window you smashed.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Motherfuck a window, Radio Raheem is dead.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: You're right, a kid is dead, but Mook, this isn't the time.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Fuck dat.  The time is fuckin' now. Y'know I'm sorry 'bout Sal's Famous Pizzeria, but I gotta live, too. I gotta get paid.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: We all know you're gonna get over with the insurance money anyway! Ya know da deal.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: You don't know shit about shit.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: How much?  How much do I owe you?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Ya just got paid, so leave me the fuck alone.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: You only pay me two-fifty a week.  I owe you fifty bucks.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: It's supposed to be even hotter today.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: You gonna open up another Sal's Famous Pizzeria?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: No.  What are you gonna do?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Yeah!...I'm goin' to the beach for the first day in fifteen years. Gonna take the day off and go to the beach.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: I can dig it.  It's gonna be HOT as a motherfucker.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Doctor, always try to do the right thing.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: I know I haven't seen you in four days.  I'm a working man.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: I work too, but I still make time.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Tina, what do you want me to do?

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: I want you to spend some time with me.  I want you to try and make this relationship work.  If not, I'd rather not be bothered.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Alright.  Alright.  I'll be over there sometime today.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: Bring some ice cream, I'm burning up.  Do you love me?

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: What took you so long?  Is it hot?

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: How else was I going to get you here?  I haven't seen you in a week.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: I've been working hard, getting paid.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: Where's the ice cream?  The Häagen- Dazs butter pecan?

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: Your memory is really getting bad.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: And I really wanted some ice cream too.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: I can run out and get it.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: No!  No!  You won't come back either.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: I can't be staying long anyway.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Long enough for us to do the nasty.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: That's out.  No!  It's too hot! You think I'm gonna let you get some, put on your clothes, then run outta here and never see you again in who knows when?

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: A quickie is good every once in a blue moon.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: Trust you?  Because of trusting you we have a son.  Remember your son?

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: I'm gonna take off ya clothes.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: Mookie, I told you already it's too fucking hot to make love.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: I'm sorry, but no rawness is jumping off tonight.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: Of course I'm sweating.  I'm burning up.  It's hot, moron, only a hundred degrees in here.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Tina, you don't have a forehead, you got a eight-head.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Yes, yes, Lord.  Isn't this better than Haagen-Dazs butter pecan ice cream?

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: Mookie, you must think I'm stupid or something.  You're gonna run outta here and I won't see your black ass for another week.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: You don't care about me and you definately don't care 'bout your son.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: Act like one then.  Be a man.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: You're to the curb.  You better step off.  Get a life.

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: Mookie, late again.  How many times I gotta tell you?

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Fuck dat shit.  I deliver pizzas. That's what I get paid for.

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: You get paid to do what we say.

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: Pop, I don't believe this shit.  We runnin' welfare or somethin'? Every day you give dat bum--

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: Give dat bum a dollar for sweeping our sidewalk.  What do we pay Mookie for?  He don't even work.  I work harder than him and I'm your own son.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Who don't work?  Let's see you carry six large pies up six flights of stairs.  No elevator either and shit.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: People are free to do what they wanna do.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Gotta go.  See ya soon.  Everybody happy now?

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: And not Larry Bird?  Who's your favorite movie star?

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Sounds funny to me.  As much as you say nigger this and nigger that, all your favorite people are "niggers."

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Pino, I think secretly that you wish you were Black.  That's what I think.  Vito, what do you say?

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: Y'know, I've been listening and reading 'bout Farrakhan, ya didn't know that, did you?

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: I didn't know you could read.

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: Fuck you.  Anyway, Minister Farrakhan always talks about the so-called "day" when the Black man will rise.  "We will one day rule the earth as we did in our glorious past."  You really believe that shit?

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Fuck you, fuck pizza, and fuck Frank Sinatra, too.

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: Well, fuck you, too, and fuck Michael Jordan.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Dago, wop, garlic-breath, guinea, pizza-slinging, spaghetti-bending, Vic Damone, Perry Como, Luciano Pavarotti, Sole Mio, nonsinging motherfucker.

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: You gold-teeth, gold-chain-wearing, fried-chicken-and-biscuit-eatin', monkey, ape, baboon, big thigh, fast-running, three-hundred-sixty- degree-basketball-dunking spade Moulan Yan.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Wait a minute.  Wait a minute.  I just got here.  You sweep.  I betcha Sal asked you first anyhow.

turns.speaker: VITO
turns.text: Mister Señor Love Daddy is cool.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Y'know, Vito, I know Pino is ya brother and shit, but the next time he hits ya, the next time he touches ya, you should "house him." Kick his ass.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: If you don't make a stand, he's gonna be beating ya like a egg for the rest of your life.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Pino, I work hard like everybody in here.

turns.speaker: VITO
turns.text: It's Prince.  He's a Prince freak.

turns.speaker: RADIO RAHEEM
turns.text: I was going to buy a slice.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: I'll be back after I make this delivery.

turns.speaker: RADIO RAHEEM
turns.text: I just copped them.  Let me tell you the story of Right-Hand--Left- Hand--the tale of Good and Evil.

turns.speaker: RADIO RAHEEM
turns.text: Brother, Mookie, if I love you I love you, but if I hate you...

turns.speaker: VITO
turns.text: See, Pop.  That's just what I was talkin' about.  Every single time you tell Pino to do something, he gives it to me.

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: Me and you are gonna have a talk.

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: Fuck you and stay off the phone.

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: My friends laugh at me all the time, laugh right in my face, tell me go feed the Moulies.

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: Good.  I want you to listen.

turns.speaker: VITO
turns.text: Jesus Christ on the cross, I said I'm listening.

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: Good.  Vito, you trust that Mook too much.  So does Pop.

turns.speaker: VITO
turns.text: Stop busting my balls.  I said I'm listening ten fucking times already.

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: Mookie is not to be trusted.  No Moulan Yan can be trusted.  The first time you turn your back, boom, a knife right here.  In the back.

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: I know so.  He, them, they're not to be trusted.

turns.speaker: VITO
turns.text: So what do you want me to do?

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: Be on guard.  Mookie has Pop conned already, so we have to look out for him.

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: And that's exactly what I'm talkin' 'bout.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Pino, get a broom and sweep out front.

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: Vito, get a broom and sweep out front.

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: I didn't want to come to work anyway.  I hate this freakin' place.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Can you do better?  I didn't think so.  This is a respectable business.  Nuthin' wrong with it.  Get dat broom.

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: Here, take the broom.  The front needs sweeping.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: I should have Vito go with you all the time.

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: Yeah, no more ninety-minute deliveries around the corner.

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: C'mere.  Don't get too friendly with da Mook.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: That's gonna be the last time you hit Vito.

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: Sal's Famous Pizzeria, yeah, two large pizzas, pepperoni and anchovies, hold on...  See, Pop, Mookie fucking talking on the phone and people are trying to call in orders.  He's making us lose business.

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: Twenty minutes.  How come you niggers are so stupid?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Mister Radio Raheem, I can't even hear myself think.  You are disturbing me and you are disturbing my customers.

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: Pop, I think we should sell this place, get outta here while we're still ahead...and alive.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Since when do you know what's best for us?

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: Couldn't we sell this and open up a new one in our own neighborhood?

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: Then we could try something else.

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: I'm sick of niggers, it's a bad neighborhood.  I don't like being around them, they're animals.

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: Pop, what else can I say?  I don't wanna be here, they don't want us here.  We should stay in our own neighborhood, stay in Bensonhurst.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: So what if this is a Black neighborhood, so what if we're a minority.  I've never had no trouble with dese people, don't want none either, so don't start none.  This is America.  Sal's Famous Pizzeria is here for good. You think you know it all?  Well, you don't.  I'm your father, you better remember that.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: You're gonna be in the street with the rest of your homeboys.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Shaddup!  Jade, what can I fix you?

turns.speaker: PINO
turns.text: Be right there, Pop.  Listen to what I said.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Both of youse--shaddup.  This is a place of business.

turns.speaker: VITO
turns.text: Pop, I'm gonna go with Mookie.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Good, make sure he don't jerk around.
